intro: Nycterinia spathacea, commonly known as the moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night and emit a strong fragrance. The plant belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is known for its rapid blooming and short-lived flowers. Its leaves are ovate and slightly hairy, while its stems are woody and often branched. Nycterinia spathacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is a symbol of nocturnal beauty in many cultures.
